data.title: Shower temperature
data.solution:
tc, th, mc, mh = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
tt, ft = [int(i) for i in input().split()]

r = (th - tt) / (th - tc)
a = int(r * ft / mc * 100) / 100
b = int((1 - r) * ft / mh * 100) / 100
print(f"{a:.02f} {b:.02f}")
data.statement:
Your shower is old and has a very sensitive mixer. It uses two separate taps—one for cold water and one for hot water. The only control you have is how much to open each tap.

Given the temperature and maximum flow rate of each tap, along with the desired overall temperature and flow rate, determine how much each tap should be opened.

Units are not useful to solve this problem, therefore they are not specified.

Hint : Try to express the resulting flow rate and temperature as functions of the flow rate of each tap, and solve the two equations to express the individual flow rates in terms of the target flow rate and temperature.
data.stubGenerator:
read tempCold:int tempHot:int maxFlowCold:int maxFlowHot:int
read tempTarget:int flowTarget:int
write 0.12 0.55
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> 4 space-separated integers [[temp_cold]], [[temp_hot]], [[max_flow_cold]] and [[max_flow_hot]], the temperature and maximum flow rate of the cold and hot water taps, respectively.
<<Line 2:>> 2 space-separated integers [[temp_target]] and [[flow_target]], the target temperature and desired flow rate.
data.outputDescription: <<One line:>> 2 space-separated floating-point numbers between 0 and 1, representing how much to open the cold and hot taps, respectively (0 = closed, 1 = fully open). Round both values down to 2 decimal places.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your shower is old and has a very sensitive mixer. It uses two separate taps—one for cold water and one for hot water. The only control you have is how much to open each tap.

Given the temperature and maximum flow rate of each tap, along with the desired overall temperature and flow rate, determine how much each tap should be opened.

Units are not useful to solve this problem, therefore they are not specified.

Hint : Try to express the resulting flow rate and temperature as functions of the flow rate of each tap, and solve the two equations to express the individual flow rates in terms of the target flow rate and temperature.
Input
Line 1: 4 space-separated integers temp_cold, temp_hot, max_flow_cold and max_flow_hot, the temperature and maximum flow rate of the cold and hot water taps, respectively.
Line 2: 2 space-separated integers temp_target and flow_target, the target temperature and desired flow rate.
Output
One line: 2 space-separated floating-point numbers between 0 and 1, representing how much to open the cold and hot taps, respectively (0 = closed, 1 = fully open). Round both values down to 2 decimal places.
Constraints
0 ≤ temp_cold ≤ temp_target ≤ temp_hot ≤ 100
1 ≤ flow_target ≤ max_flow_cold, max_flow_hot ≤ 10

temp_cold ≠ temp_hot
Example
Input
15 40 10 10
35 6
Output
0.12 0.48
